1KcPNrsK8aJtvLVhHd_w-A.text: Call before you attempt to go. Tried to get some California style burritos and they were closed 3 hours before they were supposed to close.

q9vQfLlx2kzvI9uPHlG6Hw.text: This place is a hidden jewel in Charlotte! If you like great food and friendly staff check this place out!

BHQ3ssmaO0Veh1UJCP08Ig.text: We stopped by The Burrito Factory for lunch based on all the reviews we read. I got one each of the fish, chicken, & steak tacos. The fish tacos aren't part of the Taco Tuesday deal, but I still wanted to try it. I have to say it was my favorite. The spicy chicken was not spicy at all. The steak taco wasn't as flavorful as I would have expected & had a strong flavor of I believe cilantro (but I could be wrong in that). I topped my tacos with guacamole, pico de gallo, & sour cream. I did like the green & orange sauces I received to go on the tacos. All of the staff were friendly and there was no wait time. I'm giving 4 stars because although not as flavorful as I expected the tacos weren't terrible and I would return to try out one of the burritos.

fR_EMDYaI1VCGZWEzGximQ.text: My family has had this before but today was my first time. They were very friendly and patient. Allowing me to look at all ingredients before preparing my food to order.  The food was a huge portion for the price, making it a great value. Will definitely be returning.

bJF00eou3bjUFGsY_DbKLw.text: Had the California wet burrito, it was fantastic.  Fresh food, quick and very polite service.  Will be back

WRHX9PHYrbCKDWBktV_hkQ.text: It's made to order and their staff is very nice. It can be a challenge, though, for them to hear and understand with the giant fan blowing behind you when you order.

QZvyyF3SCSQZNR-pLrqTIQ.text: Whaat? Where have you been the last 17 years, Burrito Factory and why didn't you send a tweet/carrier pigeon/smoke signal when you opened? My husband and I ventured down South on a grey Sunday, but it was all smiles and sunshine in the Burrito Factory. The owner was super friendly and walked us through the whole menu and told us his story (we asked).   I was so excited to not only have a place with several delicious homemade salsas - some without Cilantro - HALLELUJAH!!, but also California style burritos that as far as I know aren't anywhere else in town. For me, the most exciting thing was that they had Sopes. Not sopa (soup) but Sopes, which is kind of like an ultra thick corn tortilla fried which is used as a base like a tostada. It's only made in certain parts of Mexico, so until now, most of the Mexicans who owned restaurants in Charlotte were from non-sopes territory apparently. At the factory, they top their sopes with spiced pulled chicken on top of the beans and I usually like mine with ground beef, but they're so nice I'm sure they'd customize. They also had a number of really good looking salads that I will definitely try. Even their chips are delicious, and their tomatillo salsa and an orange creamy chipotle sauce is to die for.   In addition, they had flavored waters (like uncarbonated soda) and the pina colada was really delicious. We got a horchata to go as a dessert. :)  It's exactly what you want a burrito place to be - fresh ingredients, unique combinations, great salsas, fair prices and delicious salsas. Perfecto! My only complaint is its location, but word on the street is they're looking into a location somewhere closer to uptown (Dilworth maybe)? Can't wait!

sVUc58AqxrSa-WP58ZZAmA.text: Came in craving taquitos. Low and behold my wish was granted with handmade chicken rolled tacos made quickly and happily by a young man working the front bar. Service was wonderful with him explaining the kind of chicken I would receive, that it was semi spicy, and even asked my preference of "crunchiness". Food was quick, cheap and delivered with a smile. Restaurant was clean and appeared upgraded recently. Only thing I didn't like was the extra dollar fifty charge for a small ramekin of guacamole.

6HACix1oMZXvceJ8dvv1_w.text: Great place! Awesome friendly service, never overly crowded, great deals - awesome alternative to the greasy Mexican food joints out there Try the veggie burrito with steak, nomnom!

ur09VZpHSjllOA8geldi7w.text: Had the chicken curry burrito.  Very bland flavor.  Ingredients was definitely fresh and salsa bar was very good.

xsAR8iUPV-VWDuGQWel94g.text: Best burritos in Charlotte, they are gigantic. Must try the California Wet Burrito,  ground beef, queso, and french fries. 9D0GWi9ulOxA33D8DynNcg.text: After just moving here from the west coast, my husband and I havr been in desperate need of a good hand-held burrito joint. He's from San Diego, and we are both rediculously picky when it comes to mexican food. So, we were very excited after ready all the great reviews on yelp. Unfortunately,  we were both extremely disappointed. I give it a two star because I'd be willing to give it another chance, but it'll be a while. If I were asked "Do you want to go to Taco Bell or The Burrito Factory" I'd ask, "Which is closer?"  I'm a sucker for little "whole in the wall" joints so the decor and the location didn't bother me. But I was immediately turned off by the way you order. I thought if you ordered a burrito it would just come with everything on it that was listed, but it's just a typical conveyer belt like ordering counter. You have to ask for all the toppings individually. It also set me off that the only types of cheese they have are, feta, mozzarella, and nacho cheese sauce? How is this an "authentic californoa burrito" without jack or cojita cheese?   After my confusion at the counter, I finally got my bean, rice, and cheese burrito. Meh! That's it. Absolutely no flavor with the rice or beans, and the tortillas aren't fresh. I thought the only saving grace would be the salsa bar, but each salsa was just as bland as the next. They had no flavor, and no spice. What's the point of having a salsa bar if they all taste the same?   My husband got the tofu burrito (we are both vegetarian), and it was the worst cooked tofu we've ever had. If you are vegetarian DO NOT get the tofu burrito, it is wet and slimy. Terrible texture, and as bland as the rest of the meal.   I'm willing to give this place another shot based on all the amazing reviews, but I have a feeling this is not a good place for a vegetarian. Even with all the veggie options, it's not worth it. If the rice and beans are flavorless, even if I order another dish I'm worried it's not going to get better.   This place might have great meat dishes, but based on the flavor and quality of ingredients, this is in NO WAY "California style burritos". This is just another americanized, bland, burrito joint. Nothing special.

bONsUosZmXNPsJTqIjQLEw.text: Great place to enjoy a California style burrito or tacos, everything is fresh and customer service A+ all the times I been there.

AEHaQSCWy6fHZe-242UjOA.text: DON'T GO ON TUESDAY! I've been here multiple times and have had some great experiences and some terrible ones. All three of my terrible ones have all been on Tuesdays when they do Taco Tuesday. BWpl8BgoGqf-Nc1UPz_c7w.text: Not great but ok. 90 on their food service score. Service was super slow. The guys working seemed very nice and friendly just took forever to get through the line. Food was not worth the wait

5X60Nzr-PsQxF67ws_Qm-g.text: Ok, this is not the first negative experience I've had here. I forgave the first couple to maybe it was a bad time for them. Well, this afternoon was not too impressive either. With all the rave reviews, I just don't understand. They are always so slow. Disorganized is an understatement. I say it's for here and you pack half the order to go. You want cheese dip? Ok, give me several minutes to go find that size souffle cup, wait you need a lid? Let me wander off again to go get that. Before they had a salsa bar. Now, they gave one cup half full for my daughter and I to share. You need two salsas? Yes, one for each of us please. Thanks for the cold, runny cheese dip by the way. The guy running the register never smiled, not friendly at all. I guess I always catch them at bad times. I won't give them another try, too many other options out there.

W3vqdhYgn2hTyAUBKPwlLg.text: I'd rate this  3.5 if half stars were an option. The food is solid and it's certainly better than most burrito options in Charlotte but it's not as good as I was expecting based on the reviews.  You get a lot of food for your money here and for the most part, I enjoyed my burrito. However, I wasn't crazy about a lot of the sauce and salsa options and that's an important part of a burrito. They have several different hot sauces so I was initially pretty excited when I saw the salsa bar but I had trouble finding one I really liked. They all had a strange creamy taste to them and none of them were really spicy. The habanero one is the best (you have to ask for this one) but I've had better habanero sauces before. The spicy chicken on my burrito was fresh tasting and tender but it also was over salted.  In summary, it's a good place to go if you're craving a burrito but I'm not sure it lives up to the five star ratings I keep seeing.

2ER5CLFsfR7pD5XlqAyepw.text: Great food , but they try over charge you all the time ,I order 4 taco 2 beef and 2 steak all the time Same way   I got charge deferred all the time  One time $13 last , last wk $16 and today $20 I guess it's time to find anther Mexican place

qJ4JtR51JPJS3Hm41zr9Tg.text: this was a pleasant (AND TASTY) surprise! never been here and the first time i went was for lunch with two friends and we smasheddd. great portions for the price and the staff was so friendly. def going back again!

Nk3Zy7Zm8JrjcU12fW7p9w.text: I was in town for an interview. It was late in the evening. I was fighting nerves and hunger that kept welling up when anxiety was unable to keep it down. I needed food fast, safe food that wouldn't haunt me in the morning. Pickings in the area seemed scarce.  When, 'lo, a burrito champion revealed itself for the win.   I had a delicious chicken burrito with black beans and guacamole. It was fat; I was happy. My only disappointment were the lackluster chips. I have been spoiled by the variety found in wheat chips, and TBF's were just too plain jane.   But, what made TBF such a pleasant discovery still was that, despite it being late and there being only two customers, service was beyond exceptional in this rundown stripmall location.  I was greeted upon entering, and offered a taste of a curried chicken they were featuring. Delicious. The hospitality, warmth, kindness I found in TBF, not to mention the cleanliness and presentation of what is otherwise a fast-food joint, bumped them from an a-ok to man! I want another the next time I'm in town. They even have Jarritos, my non-alcoholic comfort drink during hard times.   I left calm and content, ready for the next day's intensity.

9vetyRVCmdn0Kg0KfPN6Dg.text: I went during lunch on Tuesday. They open at 11 and I got there around 11:45. There were already a good amount of people in line. The line moved at a decent pace. The food was very fresh and they have a good variety of toppings. One thing I dislike is that they don't have any salsas to add to your food. You can buy the little cups of salsa if you want for 35 cents. Guacamole is also extra (about $1.00), but it is very good. I would definitely go again. The prices are excellent!

gqMIU_N0f3XIJijoBxPRIQ.text: Let me tell you about the Burrito Factory:   It's clean, the food is fresh, the workers are very nice, they have a television inside, there's a salsa bar, the nacho chips are yummy, they have a cooler full of Jarritos and the Coca-Cola made with cane sugar (it's better than our stuff), they deliver, there's space inside to eat as well, their beans and rice will make you want to throw something because they're just that good, they have daily specials...   Most importantly, you will never be disappointed. Seriously. Just go.

4uiZIVRYY7b-tcL6uPJ8kA.text: Wow..  this really is California style mex. I am so used to being disappointed by Mexican food in the south, that I wasn't really ready to try another "burrito" place, but I decided to give it a try for lunch one day and was very impressed.  I am from Southern California - born and raised - and had an Aunt and Grandma who made the best latin food in the world.. it's not easy to impress me and I am not fooled by "hipster street tacos" or "build a burritos".   This is authentic style Mexican. I wish I could eat here more often, but unfortunately - there really isn't such a thing as low calorie latin food. Ha ha..  A great find in Charlotte for people seeking real Mex food.

QOHLX9Ys8_Fd1zxxkUV7zg.text: With all of the previous raves, I'm thinking that I must have visited on an 'off' night. I was in the area a couple of weeks ago and thanks to my yelp app, I saw that BF was literally a hop, skip and jump from my location. I went in and noticed that the place was empty which may have had something to do with the fact that they had a sign posted on the door stating their A/C was down (mind you, this was during one of our heat wave weeks). I looked at the menu really quickly and decided to go with the juicy chicken burrito.  What I immediately found odd was that I couldn't see any of the ingredients. I had to rely on the list that was posted on the plexi glass in front. Maybe they were keeping the ingredients covered due to the inside conditions (no A/C and all) but I was really turned off by that. I like to be able to see what I'm choosing! The guy who was working behind the counter was very friendly and made sure that I was aware of all my meal and sides options.  However, I wasn't all that satisfied with the taste of the burrito. I couldn't place the whether the 'different' taste I experienced was in the tortilla or rice but I was not a fan. I am more than willing to give this place another try and will probably stick with the tacos on my next go-round.

trRhhA3od9J07qQXkxsZ9g.text: Definitely won't be back. My friend and I had the steak burrito and another friend the chicken. Steak tasted like it could've came from a can (not that it did bit could've lol).   Paid $1.25 for a little teeny thing of sour cream (takeout order). $21 total for 2 steak burritos,  fries and sour cream. Had I known before we got back home I definitely would not have put that on my tab.   Fries we're greasy...they looked burnt but didn't taste like it. My friend with the chicken burrito enjoyed it. nndbLV2DzRvDMxLzVTKebA.text: I've driven by this place a bunch of times and always resolved to try it, but didn't get the chance until yesterday.  I actually checked its reviews on Yelp which helped solidify my decision to check it out after a long and painful meeting at my credit union.  Anyway, I got the chicken curry burrito and a fish taco, and my girlfriend got two veggie tacos and an order of fried plaintains.  I got a normal fountain drink and she got horchata which I took a sip of and it was quite tasty.  My burrito was excellent.  They have a ton of options to add, so I tried pickled red onions, hot salsa, shredded cheese, iceberg lettuce, and diced hot peppers (not sure which kind of pepper, coloring seemed like a mix of jalapenos and Thai chiles) to go along with the curry chicken, black beans, and (delicious) seasoned rice that came standard.  On the fish taco I got some more of the diced hot peppers, raw red onion, hot salsa, corn, and diced cucumber.  Both the burrito and the taco were delicious.  I was shocked that I actually even preferred the taco, which surprised me because it contained tilapia, which is a relatively bland fish, but everything else I added worked perfectly with the well-cooked, tender fish.  The burrito was also excellent but I ate the taco first and had a hard time finishing it because it's very large - think Qdoba-sized.  I really appreciated how they briefly pressed it in the tortilla steamer which helped keep it coherent and added a slight bit of crispness.  Their prices are very reasonable and we will certainly be back.  The only thing that detracted from the experience (but not so much as to knock it down from a 5-star rating) was the ordering process, which was a bit chaotic as they had two line workers handing off between helping us and preparing takeout orders so it could be a little confusing at times.  The gentleman working the register was very courteous and warmly greeted everyone who walked through the door.  Overall it was fantastic and I can't wait to get back.

aV1rmwWLCjc6WuTwBgodWw.text: First wrong move was getting a salad here.  I ordered the "Bambas" salad but then was basically asked to assemble my own salad, instead of them just putting together the pre-designed salad written on the board.  The tofu had a weird seasoning, and gross slightly-luke-warm temperature.    If I got a burrito I would obvi be more satisfied, but the line moved so slowly that I don't think my rating would have been much higher.    Bottom line: burrito or bust, and be prepared to wait!

vuyIxck3-Wzsa3eFTHCkng.text: The doors were locked but employees looking at me from inside! Open your doors when you're open Sunday at 6 :(

5N7iBHzB20SOwfXUF_2C2A.text: I literally signed up for Yelp just to review this place, because I was so disappointed and am hoping for answers from the establishment. The employees were very friendly - although overwhelmed, and the one salsa available at the "salsa bar" wasn't terrible. Because of the food though, this place deserves a 1.   I'd been so excited to try this place forever - I always drive by it. Today I saw a "tacos 1$ Tuesday" sign and decided it was the day. I stood in line, got my food, and the result was underwhelming to say the least. I am so saddened by the food, I don't understand how the reviews are so positive! Maybe it was an off day, I don't know.   The vegetables (pico de Gallo and corn) were fresh but not ripe enough, aka pretty tasteless. I ordered two bean and veggie tacos, and was charged full price as "veggie tacos are not part of the deal." This didn't make sense to me, considering meat is more expensive than some lettuce and corn. It would've been nice to have a note or a warning made b4 I chose that option. Just a note, because overall the employees were super friendly and made the visit almost worth it.   I also got a salad with chicken, and to my horror, apparently the only option is shredded chicken? Like the oily, putrid lunch meat shredded chicken in greasy red tasteless oil. Is there an option for grilled chicken?   Thirdly, the salsa bar was non existent.   I ended up eating my non-grilled, cold tacos out of starvation and trying to pick at lettuce from my disappointing salad. (It should be noted, the shredded chicken meat was so foul and so mixed in that the taste permeated the entire salad and I had to throw it away. I couldn't eat any of the veggies without tasting foul chicken.)  I hope to try this place again and see if it's better. At the moment though I really feel cheated out of my $.   Sorry, Burrito Factory. I wish I would've enjoyed it. I've eaten at Mexican and South American and Central American joints all over Charlotte and beyond. I love everything from Qdoba to Sabor to authentic food trucks on the side of the S Blvd. My family even owned a popular Latin restaurant here b4 selling it to retire.   So, I don't know what palette Burrito Factory is catering to, but if you tend to like authentic and tasty burritos or tacos... or yummy taco salads, this isn't the place :( .

Hu2mcEIoB_DM6gu2XKbLfQ.text: Huge portion!  Fresh and filling burrito. Prepared in front of you!   Had the quest and chips.  Nice and creamy.   I definitely will return!

photos.caption: Photo of The Burrito Factory - Charlotte, NC, United States. Look how big this burrito is!!!

YByygvw2_KT68N4KwSSy2Q.text: This is one of the few options near our apartment (other than pizza and Chinese) that will deliver to us. We have ordered from them three times, and I still have not been impressed. The rice is not seasoned and it should be because the majority of the burrito is rice. They are very sparing with the beans and the chicken.   Last time we ordered from them (estimated wait time of 30-40 minutes) the driver called 50 minutes after placing our order to say he couldn't find the address in his GPS and was still at the restaurant. When he finally did arrive the cheese fries we had ordered were cold and the queso was congealed.

FAZz3wdOk5z0CmO5o0fxcA.text: I live near The Burrito Factory and naturally I stopped in for Taco Tuesday to grab some dollar tacos and they were great! I always get spicy chicken tacos which are nicely favored, the topping are fresh. The staff is very friendly.    Bonus: The Salsa bar with great tasting salsa and other sauces for the tacos.   You can't go wrong with Dollar Spicy Chicken tacos and a Pineapple Jarritos.

YHGx_aGT6CfS1yUCklWnOw.text: 99 tacos on taco Tuesday! Their service is great and so is their food. They can be really packed on taco Tuesday's but the line goes fast and the food still comes out just right. Also, free chips with your order!

photos.caption: Photo of The Burrito Factory - Charlotte, NC, United States

Dvk2SdU37pkJf4yU8y6Xrg.text: I was in Charlotte last week with my wife on business so we stopped by this place I had bookmarked in Yelp that I was anxious to try.    When we first drove by (had to do a U-Turn) it appeared they were closed as I didn't see anyone in the parking lot.  Once we got there the parking lot was definitely empty but the sign said open.  Once we arrived inside this local place I was impressed with the customer service we received.  These people are very friendly and we had the pleasure to get to know the manger on duty Issac.  Such as great guy and was really interested in hearing about our experience as well as information regarding Yelp.  We probably had a 10 min conversation discussing YELP alone which we always are gratefully to give our experiences since we have the BEST YELP ambassador in Asheville (Kipper !!!!)  Onto the meal as that is what you want to hear about right?  My wife was looking for a Gluten Free (GF) meal but had nothing on the board labeled as such...BUT they accommodated her by making her a bowl with the ingredients she chose.  This made her very happy.  HAPPY wife = Happy LIFE.  I chose the steak burrito since they were out of tamales which I was really craving but they were out.  HOPEFULLY on my next trip they will have these for me to try!.  The meat was tender and all of the ingredients including the rice were on point.  The habanero sauce was a nice touch of heat.  We also had chips and queso which were yummy.  My only wish was this was about $1-$1.50 cheaper per item which would really make this 5 stars in my book.  Great place give it a try you will be glad you did and support the locals!

VKEHI8SY_m--LGu5vfzZeQ.text: My husband and I spent the day in Charlotte last week.  Apparently my husband had bookmarked this place.  I'm so glad he did.  It was a little scary at first.  There wasn't anyone in the parking lot, it looked desolate.  It was 11:30 and we had just beat the lunch rush.  Right after we ordered and sat down, it got busy.  They don't have anything labelled Gluten Free (GF).  When I asked, they were more than happy to accomodate.  They made me a bowl, a steak burrito without the tortilla, not on the menu.    We were fortunate to also get to meet Isaac.  He made sure we were satisfied with food and service.  Zero complaints....thanks for the great lunch!

2hkaSG6oy5NWZaI5zo7wyA.text: A True hidden gem! This place is authentic fresh food at a great price! The atmosphere is completely chill. The service was fast & friendly. Try the California style chicken curry burrito! You won't be disappointed!

photos.caption: Photo of The Burrito Factory - Charlotte, NC, United States. California style chicken curry burrito. #perfection

Romsvul1jIPis0z3si0hHQ.text: OK, so I'm now finally convinced that The Burrito Factory makes the BEST Burrito's in Charlotte! I had to give them the final and 5th star because you just cannot help but LOVE the passion and enthusiasm of the brother/sister team who own/run/manage/work this place. They are SO nice and you can tell that they LOVE what they do and that they LOVE their food. What's NOT to love about a big burrito with very fresh ingredients that YOU choose! They'll make anything you want and the way you want it. No skimping here!  Not the fanciest place, but you get one HELL of a deal always served with a super friendly face, with yummy food. Doesn't get much better than that! People are really starting to discover this place so you may expect waits at peak times. Highly recommended!

cEd1b-o-S7YxdCW4YMsCnw.text: Its nothing amazing. The only amazing thing about this place is that each time I wanted to eat there, they were close and that made this place to be saved under my bookmarks. I tried it and...meh! When you are in this part of town, I suggest you go to another Mexican place to eat. The prices are OK, the food is OK, the service is wonderful, the environment not the greatest to look at. So, yeah..pretty much not a charmer. However, I am still interested to see how the $1 Taco night are. So, I will be returning on a Tuesday night and maybe I might change my mind and add or possibly even reduce the rating by a star. But one thing is clear, the owners or if they are not the owners and rather workers, are def. trying their best and are super friendly.

6R0MNNmHz9FJz5qbHPt8OA.text: My second time here was just as good as my first. Owner is super friendly and staff is very nice. The best thing about the food is the freshness. They definitely use fresh ingredients and you can taste the difference. The salsa bar is a must try here as we'll. This is a go to spot for lunch and bring an appetite because you won't leave hungry.

photos.caption: Photo of The Burrito Factory - Charlotte, NC, United States

nCBadYRzfS5NHt4NrzYw-A.text: This place has the best burritos! You need to try the Burrito Al Pastor. It's delicous and the burritos are huge.  Way better than Phat Burrito or Chipotle! They even deliver if you're close by.  I highly recommend this place.  Great food and good service.

1y7J-BQ4dr3-ltWfLpoSQQ.text: yesterday was my first time coming to the burrito factory and i am so glad i did. it was taco tuesday with .99 cents taco. Everything was extremely fresh and the staff was friendly. I will definitely have to come earlier because they ran out of a few items but i did come 30 mins before close. cant wait till next tuesday

9M7yIUC5CN0MpEKehRa8fA.text: Nope, not a dancing burrito but "The Burrito Fatory"  will leave you dancing out of the establishment. This place stands out on South Blvd where there is a surplus of Tex-Mex and California style food establishments. This is a usual quick lunch spot for me. On Tuesdays they have 99 cent tacos and they have a massive burrito which will rival any Moe's or Qudoba burrito. Unlike chain restaurants The Burrito Factory actually sells fish and tofu, plus different types of tortillas. The salsa bar here is 2nd to none in Charlotte, The downfall about The Burrito Factory is that their chips are harder than what I'm sure anyone is use to, though they may pile them up with whatever you order they should really work on that recipe.  The Manager/Owner is very cool and hip to what's going on. Overall if your looking for a Big Ass Burrito at a great price and your on the South side of Charlotte you have to stop by The Burrito Factory.

photos.caption: Photo of The Burrito Factory - Charlotte, NC, United States

pq2pLSgiI77wUKmzb_44TQ.text: Got take out on a road trip. It was oh so good. The kid's burrito was huge. Between the 3 kids they only ate about one total. Tamales were excellent.   Fish tacos and veggie tacos were worth the money. I think I'd try one of their specialty items next time.

VsrbQ8UPviLlgy4F-9bu2A.text: I can't say enough good things about this place! They're so friendly, the food is good, reasonably priced and super fresh ingredients. They don't go light on meat or toppings like most places do! We are now regulars!

Jl2x3APlAaCYiPR_mAcvWw.text: REALLY good shrimp burrito. Lots of shrimp and nice and juicy, not some dried out husk of a burrito. Sauce station could use some love though.

Ixwm_OYhcg9htPgXlKL3Lw.text: Very solid burritos here. I usually get a burrito bowl it is a really huge portion especially if you opt for the bowl variety.  Do your self a favor if you like shrimp try the chipotle shrimp burrito.  It is the absolute truth..

-ItoQzSIfiQLT6junfDoQQ.text: So, The Burrito Factory is located on South Blvd. and can be missed if you are not paying attention. Although the outside is somewhat blah, the interior is clean and designed with a somewhat trendy feel & TV for your enjoyment. Upon arrival, we were a little confused at the layout, where to order (being the only ones there), but was questioned by the cook  who stepped out behind the counter. We ordered one chicken burrito & one chicken quesadilla w/ chips & guacamole. Being there is only one cook, things do move a little slow, but everything is fresh & you select you additional items from behind the counter, that included cheese, lettuce, jalapenos, onions, etc. We paid and hit the salsa bar, which offered a variety of flavors. Although others Yelpers enjoyed, we thought some were a little too hot, too bland, etc. nothing seemed to hit the perfect mark. And, the soda machine offered no ice, so the owner/manger took our cups to the back to fill with ice, strange.  However, the food & chips arrived fresh, hot and were delicious. The chicken burrito had rice & beans, along with the additions and was great. The chicken quesadilla was just as good. Both fresh chicken, great rice & beans! I did enjoy the guacamole, but do wish I enjoyed the salsa as much.   I would love to give them a 3.5, but that is not an option. I will be back, knowing how things work, but recommend to those first timers, don't be in a rush & try everything..

81T4bLpFkiYuN4VAbtVOZg.text: Great food for the price, especially taco Tuesdays. Not so great service. The guy was really nice, but the girl who took our order acted like we were an inconvenience. I understand you are busy but with $1 tacos, what do you expect. Oh well, I can manage taking someone's attitude for a minute to be enjoy good food!

73g_WGOLqRyXfD0JTnwoKQ.text: My first time visting. pleasantly surprised. Will try again. Burrito good. Place was clean and prices reasonable. Got the steak burrito lunch special and came tortilla chips and sauce bar. Yum.

Jmx67PsT1VZHBt-DZ1JMDg.text: Taco Tuesday is clutch..99 cent tacos...very fresh...nachos and salsa all great

B61tQytqDMJLycOGhynOYg.text: Oh, how I wish Chip Nutty had worked out (yelp.com/biz/chip-nutty-...), but alas, it wasn't in the cards. Instead we get The Burrito Factory. I usually select local, one-store, type businesses over the chain ones for two reasons, to support local business and because they are usually fresher, better and made with more love than those chain factories. Unfortunately, The Burrito Factory didn't have that local feeling I was looking for. Now, their food is NOT bad by any stretch of the imagination. But there really wasn't any real flavor or soul to speak of. My burrito was very bland despite the fact that I added nearly everything they had to offer. My mother ordered a couple of tamales and they literally just plop two tamales on a place and put some weird cheese-base sauce over them. Nothing else... That's not how you serve tamales. The day we went they had a local Latin radio station truck outside, which is how we noticed the place and decided to stop. Unfortunately, aside from what looked like an excessive number of servers and what I think was one of the owners and his buddies, there was nobody there but us. Their menu is simple and has some good offers. One of the cool features is their salsa bar, which has some very unique salsas you usually don't see anywhere else. Not a bad place to eat, but I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here.

yWvM7htdwRyVzUA29o_KJA.text: Tried it for the first time last Thursday which was coincidentally $5.49 for anything on the menu day, score! The language barrier while ordering does exist but not too bad. I got the chicken curry California burrito which was pretty good, a little bland but still miles above Chipotle-it amazes me how many people like that place..  Salsa bar was a nice touch but for me the only one that had any flavour was the factory hot. Habanero I believe. Even for a seaoned chili head I will give warning- take it slow. Ordered a bit too much on my burrito which I was warned of, caution to the wind I said!! Still great taste even if my eyes were watering :)  The food could use a bit more flavour but at it's price point I'm not complaining. BTW, the manager or owner-not sure is very friendly and helpful. I will be back for sure.

1LNIjPlReEjw2xLzQjUgTQ.text: Really surprised at how nice this place was. I expected a dump and got a very pleasant first impression. Inside looks a lot like Chipotle, although nothing will ever beat Chipotle's burritos in my very biased mind. They had interesting toppings so you can choose a Mexican or American style wrap. Their salsa bar was cool, although I didn't really care for any of their salsas. I think one of them was actually a little rancid but it didn't turn me off to the experience as a whole for some reason. I got the chicken burrito special which came with chips for only $4.99. Can't beat that! Will definitely go back.

photos.caption: Photo of The Burrito Factory - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Burrito Factory - Charlotte, NC, United States. The inside was very nice and clean.
Photo of The Burrito Factory - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lots of salsas to choose from.

EaPRw2bJTxTvrbDFtgf3RQ.text: Great FRESH Mexican food.   We ordered the curry chicken burrito (special for 4.99) and the shrimp burrito (8.49). You pick your toppings from the back side of the glass counter (like Chipotle, Salsarita's and Qdoba). It's a tiny place with small trays of toppings. They had fresh and pickled jalapenos, fresh guacamole and a few basic burrito fillers. Unlike most chains, they serve Tilapia, shrimp and tofu. You also have the choice of wheat OR flour tortilla. We were told that soon quinoa will be on the menu.    Pro's: fresh ingredients, lots of flavor, assorted salsas at the salsa bar, good value, friendly service, healthy choices (tofu and wheat tortillas). They serve burritos, tacos, salads and quesadillas. Kid's menu too.   Con's: One person working the counter (don't go if you are in a hurry), chips were thick and a little stale.   I would have given them a 5 if their chips were better, the serving size was a little bigger and the service was faster.  They just opened and will have some teething pains. I hope they make it.  Comparisons  Salsarita's = TBF had fewer choices but the food tasted better with the exception of the chips. Wish they had fajita veggies.  Love the fresh jalapenos.   Chipotle = Same as above. Service was WAY BETTER than Chipotle. TBF had smaller portions. TBF has queso and Chipotle does not.   Phat Burrito = TBF has more flavor and a more interesting menu. About the same interior size but no awkward line out the door like PB. TBF has more windows and feels cleaner. Salsa bar is better too.

kkBi525rhEX_KDHevSMccQ.text: I ordered the carnitas and carne asada tacos thru postmates...I'm so glad they left the receipt in the bag so I knew where it came from. So good! I'm definitely stopping by this place to order these again!

t3jSD8guRxhLhmUbs5wUtg.text: This place was awesome. It looks like a hole in the wall, but the food was amazing. They cook it to order so it's fresh and yummy! Only reason for four stars instead of five is it was very hot in the restaurant.

qlSXNGQSw9g6vuWvQ8t8Nw.text: This place was a great for a  lunch date. The line was kinda long but understandable since the orders are made to order.  Had the California wet burrito and it was amazing. Hubby had the fish tacos and already asked when we will be back. Definitely 5 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of The Burrito Factory - Charlotte, NC, United States

u9y_bzHcUX_Hb226mIAZEg.text: You had me at $.99 tacos!   So I've literally driven by this place hundreds of times and always say I'm going to give them and try...and it just never worked out. Until a few weeks ago when my coworkers and I gave them a try for Taco Tuesday. I mean $.99 tacos....always count me in!   When we arrived it was a long line, which is always a good sign. I tried three tacos: a steak, spicy chicken and beef. They were all yummy. There were plenty of toppings to add and they all come with chips and salsa.   You can't ask for a better lunch deal. It's fast, cheap and yummy!

qw0OqNLuAzGui4bCNxr_lw.text: I haven't had anything more than their tacos, but they are hands down the best tacos ever! It's very filling and the chips and salsa (the orange one...I don't know the name) is a wonderful accompaniment. One of these days I'll try something else, I'm sure The Burrito Factory won't disappoint.

jvCxTX7k-IrczD3Mz09AFw.text: Along the stretch of road that we Charlotteans call "Burrito Way" is of course, the Burrito Factory (which shall be referenced as BF). A shining star in a desert of Central American "burrito special with rice and beans for $5.95" restaurants.  A bit like the Californian burrito joints that have gone mainstream like Chipotle and Moe's, BF has a menu board of various meats and recipes already put together, but this is America and if you want to add or remove, you go right ahead.  I opted for the Curry Chicken Burrito and asked for extra tomatoes and onions. It was extremely tasty. For my wife, I got their veggie burrito with extra cilantro and she absolutely loved it.  Chips were great - maybe a little thicker than I like. Salsa bar was decent. The pico de gallo was really great - not hot at all. Yum.  I wish this place every success!

GhU8n1Oyv2K8pWSYOGaZTA.text: Hello Friends,   The Burrito Factory is a South Side Staple in the community. Great service. Fast Service. Good quality toppings, meats, chips, etc. The last i was there they had a sign saying "We apologize for the inconvenience but we are installing a new AC unit". It was hot as heck in there and it was still people dining in and ordering take out. Food MUST be good for people to take that kinda heat inside a building.   Tuesday is 99 cent day Thursday is One Price day $7.49 (I believe)   The different sauce that you can get with your meal are great. From mild to hot. I like this place, you go for yourself and i think you will as well.   Go Enjoy,  TTFN

photos.caption: Photo of The Burrito Factory - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Burrito Factory - Charlotte, NC, United States. Great heat

6m112Y16AKscFouBH7kKzw.text: Had high hopes. We ordered steak tacos, everything looked tasty and fresh. I got mild salsa on the side and my wife got pico.  None of it had any flavor. The steak tasted like boiled meat. The cheese might as well not have been there. The salsa was almost definitely tomato paste with cilantro. The pico was bland. The chips were also pretty flavorless.  I don't know what everyone else is eating here, but it can't possibly be what we ate. Hard pass indefinitely...  It gets an extra star because of the friendly staff and Mexican drink selection.

aCpqkUxpooBsvKAuj-gvJw.text: addiction devotion to, dedication to, obsession with, infatuation with, passion for, love of, mania for, enslavement to  That is all.   Okay so I do have more to say, but that pretty much does sum up my relationship with Burrito Factory.   I, like many, first stumbled upon Burrito Factory through yelp and also because of their, wait for it, $1 Taco Tuesdays!! That's right. ONE DOLLAR. With that dollar, you get the most seasoned and flavorful meat I've ever had in a taco (choice of chicken, ground beef or pulled pork - YES to all) and a hearty serving of chips. You also get over 20 different ingredients at your fingertips. Mine are always filled with lettuce, tomatoes, cilantro, onions, cucumber, corn, feta, pico de gallo, habanero sauce, fresh jalapenos and pickled jalapenos. I like it HOT! Guacamole and queso are available for a small charge. I recommend queso. Always queso. ALWAYS. Also, on Thursdays, EVERYTHING on the menu is $5.49!   So what has kept me coming back (basically twice and week.. And way more than I'd really like to admit)? Well aside from the food, of course, the people are some of the sweetest I have ever met. I'm actually writing this review because we've reached this comfortable, embarrassing zone of our relationship where the employees recognize me. Today, one of them asked why don't I just start working at Burrito Factory since I'm always here (see.. embarrassing). Well, Burrito Man, that would just be feeding an addiction that I'm already having trouble quitting! Plus, I don't see how that is a good business choice on your behalf, as I would eat everything I touch.   Can this place get any more magical, you ask? Why yes. Yes, it absolutely can, because they have a SALSA BAR. Made fresh every day and filled with a variety of yummy deliciousness! I always mix the pico de gallo with the green sauce (properly named as the tomatillo mild) and that is my happy place. The first time I came here, I tried every single sauce that they have. One was out and one of their employees actually SAW that I didn't get that one, brought it from the back and to my table, without me ever saying a word! Mind you, this isn't a full service type place. It's casual. It's fun. It's delicious.   Basically, I will probably keep coming here every Tuesday for the rest of life.   Recommendations 1. Taco Tuesday 2. Nachos with Pork 3. Cali Style Chipotle Shrimp Burrito

photos.caption: Photo of The Burrito Factory - Charlotte, NC, United States. Curry Chicken Burrito Sans Tortilla :)
Photo of The Burrito Factory - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fish Burrito To Go Sans Tortilla :)

_pZA2AYopbnnp8hUOoGzMw.text: This place sucked. The person who served me was extremely rude and whispered the whole time so when I couldn't hear him he would roll his eyes. He told me the queso wasn't ready but then I saw another guy give it to a customer after me. They literally put two barely fried, cold French fries in my burrito. The ground beef was salty. I really wanted to love this place and rarely give one star reviews but I left so disappointed. It must've been a bad day for them.

9smZLyMjMiq4frIfoVRbyQ.text: After braving the crazy crowds to go shopping on a Saturday morning (seriously though, people need to learn how to chill), I was wiped and had to grab something to keep my stomach and road rage in check. As I passed by the Burrito Factory, I remembered the delicious fare they had to offer and decided to swing in. The short and sweet version is really good tex mex at a stupid low price.   I have been here (or taken out) food a few times. The tacos are great and are a buck a piece on Tuesdays. I have also had the burritos, which are about the size of my head and have the same density as a brick. Also the meals come with chips and access to a salsa bar. Everything I have had is fresh and you really get a good bang for your buck.   The decor is pretty simple and nothing to really write home about. Either way, it gets the job done. Also the few times I have been the staff always seems a bit overworked. However, it was never enough to keep me from coming back. Keep up the great work churning out awesome food!

SlbKswTBoZ3Hy67U0v7SZA.text: I absolutely love this place! The owners and staff are very nice and the food is outrageously delicious! All the ingredients are fresh, like just chopped kinda freshness! The burritos are MASSIVE! So delicious. Just get here, and quickly.

photos.caption: Photo of The Burrito Factory - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken tacos. Side of guac and queso

ocjnSJLW1s9ud4O2JIEYzg.text: Tried burrito factory for the first time today. First off,  customer service was outstanding. They were very patient, kind, and helpful.   The burrito is huge and filling. It's good for the price! I ordered the curry chicken burrito with pinto beans. It was good but I feel like my meat and beans could have had more flavor though. I'll definitely go back to try the steak and the shrimp burritos!!

TS6r_OMXHY9JXQkgHkRcyA.text: We love coming here, the food is delicious and the staff are all friendly. we aren't vegetarian but we always order the veggie burrito. It comes with freshly cooked squash and kale and it's so yummy. What I love about this place over a Chipotle or something is the toppings. Feta, pickled onions, olives, etc. you can really make a yummy unique burrito. Also really love their guajillos salsa. They have a very spicy version behind the bar as well as the mild one they serve on the side with chips. Its the best thing about this place!

qK0r3nb0uUe3NJtitX3pMA.text: A local spin off Chipotle, this place was fast and delicious!  We ordered the Nachos and California Style Fish burrito to split. I have to admit this was my first fish burrito and I loved every bite of it. It had grilled tilapia, plantains, cheese, jalapenos and guacamole. Made to order. I put a little bit of everything on the nachos with extra cheese sauce. We were stuffed before we could finish our meals.  Best part of Burrito Factory is their sauces/salsas. All meals seem to come with their signature medium sauce. I upped the ante and got their habanero salsa (a must if you love spicy). Great spot for lunch, not too far off the beaten path from Southend. We'll be back!

IJDSb-echhAakpZKJl4YvA.text: Horrible! Walked in here with a Restaurant.com certificate and was told the new ownership stopped selling these however we saw they were selling them this morning! Glad we asked before spending $50! Be warned- no attempt here to try to get new customers!

w4F-gU-xN7eGaH0VvMNBhg.text: Was pretty good and the burrito was good size for the money. Chips and choriqueso was yummy!!! I'll try again and get another meat other that plain ol steak.

olgzM6gW-PuW6ihZ6EnZrg.text: Hiving them 5 bc its my first time going, and it was great. Awesome value and taste. Salsa aioli is great with the chips and on the taco. Highly rec

XgxT_Fpijl8gPSltrEOfqA.text: My favorite taco/burrito place in all of Charlotte! The quality of food is very high and you get a lot for your money. The staff is always friendly and helps me with my orders when I'm not sure what I'm feeling like. Service is also always fast. I'm in and out in under 5 to 10 mins everytime. I recommend this place to all my friends looking for a quick, affordable, somewhat healthy choice for lunch lol.

cfwnAyfpiDU_OILn_33rZg.text: Quick recap: delicious burritos. Unique flavors. Friendly staff and overall a great value. Strongly recommend the burritos and the fried plantains.   If you like burritos, you need to come here. They give you fat burritos that are jam packed with goods. Got the price it's an amazing deal.   Tacos are also good but if I had to choose, I would go with the burritos. I strongly recommend the fried plantains as well. They taste authentic. They don't mess with it, it's just fried and served.

ANfgGjnXIxrVQ2RXn_bMgg.text: I love this place. It's better than most of the chain burrito places and has some ingredients you won't find just anywhere. The guy behind the counter was a bit chatty but he ended up giving us some free authentic soup I would've never known about had he not talke

9MZV1OvFVC1r9LgdZpM34A.text: This place might fool you since it's very small. But this place is like mini- chipotle. The employees are super nice and this place is very family-friendly. They have really good Happy-Burritos and and pricing is very convenient. I would totally recommend this to anyone that sees this place while driving! L

Oiwl_UqLwTV9_19xGnPQVw.text: Love this place! I'm obsessed with burritos and these by far are amazing. They have many different options and they will make pretty much anything you want. The employees are very friendly and it seems to be a family-owned business. They offer many different options/sauces that you can't get at the chains. I've been several times and recommend trying this place out!

FYcjjmQwk15HzZobtZLLnA.text: I love this place!  You order burritos with whatever ingredients you choose. I got a burrito with guacamole, tomatoes, corn, lettuce, onion and ground beef - everything was fresh and delicious. I also ordered a side of the plantains which were also amazing. Everyone was very helpful.  I don't usually like burritos but this place definitely changed my mind.

TkVtpjK5RN_XHfhrIrWCcw.text: Was pleasantly surprised with this fresh burrito joint! Being from San Diego,CA and having great burrito joints everywhere I was a bit nervous but was impressed with the food quality and service was great very friendly staff! Would definitely visit again

FcNmHmVd5E0bUxhNNNW_eA.text: Probably not a place I would have normally stopped at had it not been recommended to me. The staff is ridiculously friendly. The food was great, and the salsa bar was my favorite. What a simple, yet great idea. I will definitely be going back again!

BDbIow75-C9THpCDwVstlw.text: my favorite!! The shrimp burritos are mine and my boyfriend's favourite! We go here at least once a week.

cxPGh9qmT8yyOrfCPieQpA.text: Great Burrito!  On Thursdays they have $5.49 Burritos and it's a steal.  I had the Chipotle shrimp burrito and my wife had the fish and plantain burrito. Both were excellent!  Try the Salsa bar as well!!  The owners were so kind as to bring our 3 year old a free cup of milk and a side of rice and beans (also free). It's service like this that makes customers for life!  We will be back!!

6rHCPZ6niMqZL1L5D_h6tA.text: Probably 3.5 stars but hey what with the great service I had, in the really really fresh salsa ingredients I rounded up to 4.

2gUvDmSOQEqzMLEfEehglA.text: A former co-worker recommended this place last time I was in the area and now I drive 30+ minutes from Steele Creek to get their burritos.  Hands down the best burritos I have ever eaten, especially for this town.  Owner is extremely friendly and always makes sure we are enjoying our food.  Very affordable, with a $4.99 special every day, and $0.99 taco Tuesday.  I recommend the Cali chicken curry burrito, AMAZING!  This place puts Moe's and Chipotle to shame, they don't even hold a candle to one of these burritos.  I honestly don't know if I'll ever be able to eat another burrito from one of those chains again because it just won't compare and it'll be more expensive.

pc9jXPS4oQwVgpc6hgIrkA.text: I ate here yesterday it was my first time so I was unsure but as soon as I walked in everyone was so nice they gave us Intel on the menu and just my like the special was everything on the menu is 5.49 it was so many item I didn't know what to choose from so I ended up with a burrito chips guacamole and queso. All their food was delicious and fresh. I was highly satisfied and the owner was really friendly. I would recommend it to any one is looking for quality fresh cuisine in charlotte.

gXeWqQtdLNZuEm-IwN7Dcg.text: First burrito and taco spot we've been to in CLT. They offer a Cali menu of options, that gave us the excitement to go since I grew up in CA, been in TX. So hubby and I wanted to check it. We are always on the hunt for amazing food. Ordered the Cali burrito which was good, steak taco and fish tacos which weren't so great, just wish they weren't frozen. I'll stick to the steak.  May return if we're in the area and feel like having tacos and burritos. Service was ok.

photos.caption: Photo of The Burrito Factory - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Burrito Factory - Charlotte, NC, United States

zhqo97iPIEDuAJ71RnuRCw.text: I ordered this from Postmates at work. I am sure glad we did. I had them Choriqueso Burrito and it was super good. It was packed with food, hot and not lacking in taste. They gave me a side of Chips and Green Salsa/Guac that has a really nice bite to it. I dumped it on my burrito and it was perfect. I wish i took some pictures but once I remembered I was already almost finished.   I will be coming for more Burrito Factory! Juicy Steak burrito... you are next.

G6GyRloT8_tFo6cBRaZyeA.text: I really hate to give only two stars. But there really wasn't  anything special about my one trip here. Service was good. Both people working took my order  and put the order together quickly. I was disappointed because what I ordered all tasted bland. I had a chicken quesadilla and two beef tacos. I didn't even eat one taco. It was overly greasy for my tastes. Nothing stood out, not even the chips. Maybe I was there on an off day or maybe I am missing what others seem to really like about this place. Eh, sometimes things are a miss.

0mSaowzEissAFGhU10I3qQ.text: There is a Taco Tuesday for every preference in Charlotte and the Burrito Factory fills the niche of takeout flour tortilla, especially in the middle section of South Blvd.  $0.99 tacos with chicken, beef, or pork, plus a smattering of other fillings like cheese shredded lettuce, pico, cilantro, and others. Sour cream and guacamole are extra. Queso dip with chips and the slightly spicy special (orange) sauce are a must.  The service here is much friendlier than it necessary for such a solid deal on tacos. I've enjoyed a hearty burrito here in the past, but find that I don't veer to far from my spicy chicken tacos these days. Only thing I would change would be to use a different serving utensil for the meats so that you wouldn't have any residual liquid poured into the taco, as it makes it a bit messy. Really though, this place has it dialed in for a good Tuesday lunch or dinner.

Z50ZUkUyWOx4GxtPOXu2ow.text: Finally got to try the Burrito Factory for the first time the other day.... I see why people rave about it now.  For a [Taco] Tuesday, they had a steady flow of customers, but never really a huge line out the door, unlike some other (cough, cough) places.  99 cent tacos only applies to chicken, pork, or beef tacos, but I had a regular priced fish taco that was super tasty.  Also tried the chorizo queso dip with chips... I can probably eat through a bucket of that stuff and die a happy person.... just don't open up the coffin anytime soon...  The restaurant itself is nothing glitzy... the focus is on tasty food that only sticks around a little bit cause people keep consuming it so fast.  I want to say the place has the bones of a Long John Silvers or Captain D's... but they've painted away the blue and white with black and gray.  A few tables can be pushed together to accommodate large groups, but probably only 1 or 2 large groups.  I noticed some extra chairs stacked on the side, so it's a bit of a free for all in the dining area.    The staffers are super nice and want to make sure you have the best experience possible. We got there at 8pm... and totally forgot it closed at 9pm.  They didn't rush us out or anything... so we only really "got it" when we were the last ones there after a mass exodus to the doors.  I'm sure they were tired from all the tacos they had been slinging all day long....  I need to come back and try other stuff on their menu... what I tasted so far was really great.

Zf5e2_vYc5QMY1gYU_TuNQ.text: 99 Taco Tuesday!! Do I seriously need to say any more?! You're right... I should!   I arrived around 12pm having never eaten nor heard of this place (I know, I know) and the line wasn't that bad. It did get longer around 12:15-12:20p so I got extremely lucky. The employees were pleasant and served everyone as quickly as possible without making you feel rushed to choose the variety of toppings.   I ordered three tacos (2 spicy chicken, 1 beef) and I was pleased to learn that I was supplied with a nice amount of meat on all three. I also appreciated that the meat remained covered until someone wanted it (it's the little things, that make my tummy smile).   The food was good and filling. The only missing was a side of salsa for the chops that came with it. I will definitely be returning to try a burrito in the [near] future.

photos.caption: Photo of The Burrito Factory - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tres Tacos

wg3aO4-NN0XhfoRHHMQXqg.text: Food is flavorful but definitely not close to California style Mexican as is mentioned on their menu. The only place in California that you will get ground beef and melted cheese in a burrito is Taco Bell. The fish taco was good. Salsa was on point. Again, if you are looking for California style Mexican food this is not the place.  Also, no corn tortillas and they warm their flour tortillas in what looks like a panini maker.

l6wHeT4_m6o-l9x488likw.text: Had for lunch in Friday for the first time. Delivered to our business. Late then forgot one of my colleagues' salads. When we called to ask that they bring it, they didn't even consider it and instead just said they would refund the money for the salad. Not acceptable.   The food was okay. The chicken burrito is undoubtedly one of the biggest I've eaten. But it was pretty dry and was mostly filled with rice - which I like but is not what I want my chicken burrito filled up with. The chips were good and my colleagues were all relatively happy with their food too. But not enough to worry about ordering there again.

m4GFNamQgtnHeasBA9iPjg.text: Best burrito I've had since moving to Carolina. The ladies that work there are super helpful and friendly. Lots of choices of burritos or tacos. I had a California burrito. The burrito was massive, so a really good value. The fries they put in the burrito didn't have any flavor so it wasn't my favorite. I would definitely go back though and try something different.

photos.caption: Photo of The Burrito Factory - Charlotte, NC, United States

C7Lp8CNV9q1ybfiDon0XzQ.text: This place never disappoints... I drive across town to get it in on the dollar taco Tuesday special! It's a great place for vegans/vegetarians! You pay for the chips & salsa....But that's ok! It's worth it! Sooooo fresh & delicious!

3Dins99-dYpaJ_VxDc7KGw.text: This review is super delayed, but this place is magic.  Taco Tuesday was a must-do when I lived in Charlotte, and if I still lived there the tradition would go on.  The tacos are all delicious and customizable.  I never left hungry or unsatisfied. Big thumbs up!

klbf_0X1WNxDh3bqNAAhoQ.text: Great service. The burritos are the biggest I've seen and are a great price with extremely fresh ingredients! I will definitely be coming back here!

LlyuNsXRf0wcA7vw1BGyYw.text: In Charlotte for work and decided to get some tacos on #TacoTuesday. When driving up to the location, it's hard to get it , had to park at the plaza next door . Not much curb appeal. Once you walk in, looks like any other TexMex place. First time here and was confused on how to order, or even where to start ! The ladies inside were nice, spoke both spanish and English.  Decided to order in spanish. They could barely hear me due to the loud music.  Got to the register, and paid $15 for 3 tacos, chips & guacamole and a soda. Like whatttttttt!!  I wouldn't complain, if the food was at least edible.  The presentation was nice but my steak tacos lacked flavor, were super wet and cold. ... the guac had absolutely no flavor. . & the chips, well they wrre soggy. . Couldn't even finish . It wasn't even worth it .

08N_QZ5ESrzDtOValASlfQ.text: I have been to burrito factory for taco Tuesday and it has yet to disappoint. 99 cent tacos!!!! Where else in Charlotte can you get this cheap of tacos? Let me know because I'd love to find the competitor and see if it even comes close to competing with burrito factory.   Be aware, Tuesday's do tend to get busy. There may be a long line but they are very time efficient and it usually goes pretty fast. It's set up like a taco buffet, two things I cannot resist! They have every topping you can think of and the choice of chicken, spicy chicken, pork, or beef-all delicious. Your tacos come with chips so no need to order extra! The size of the tacos may seem small,  but don't be fooled, once you have the toppings and chips, you will be more than satisfied! I have not tried anything other than the taco Tuesday deal but the whole menu looks really good and definitely worth trying!   The staff are sooo friendly, especially the first guy you hit who asks how many tacos you want. He is constantly smiling and can't help but put a smile on your face too.   Burrito factory is a little bit down south boulevard but worth the trip!!

ayB2zClUSAtlBVQV96XTmA.text: Awesome burritos!  I've been looking for a local alternative to Chipotle and found it in The Burrito Factory.  This is not a fancy place but a place that serves good food dosn't have to be fancy or trendy. You start off like any build to order place...starying at the menu. They have burritos and other options but the thing to get here is the burrito. I've had the chicken and choriqueso with my choice of other ingredients. Both ended up being the most flavorful burritos I've had.  Their proteins are seasoned well and their hot salsa is killer!   Top that off with a friendly staff and decent prices and you have a winner.  This is now my go to burrito place in Charlotte. Forget Chipotle!

9EutSpXFtkw17kl9uipHqA.text: The prices are really reasonable.  The 90.5 rating by the health department was concerning.  The service was slooooooooooow.   The most important part is the food though.... and it was good enough to go back again.  I had the California wet burrito - which means it has cheese sauce and French fries on it as well as your choice of protein.  It was filling and I left happy.    My biggest complaint is that the French fries weren't crisp - they had sat for too long on the fryer.

photos.caption: Photo of The Burrito Factory - Charlotte, NC, United States. Burrito

-xhUyHjXCj8bp4MUYuIKUg.text: I had a craving for a chicken burrito so we yelped (lol) a spot. We read good reviews so we decided to give this place a chance. OMG! The food was delicious. The burrito was so big we couldn't eat it in one sitting. We will definitely go back.

ys0XmXocT4P0o2IIbibKTw.text: After having this joint bookmarked for months, my wife and I finally decided this was the perfect Friday night to venture down South Blvd and see what the hype was alllll about.   I opted for the fajita veggie burrito with steak. Plenty of options for toppings, all of which looked fresh to death. Also decided to give the chorizo queso a spin. The best part of the Burrito Factory experience? SALSA BAR! This is without a doubt the best salsa bar in charlotte (sorry all of you Sabor lovers, don't hate me). The green salsa was my overall winner, but you can't go wrong with any of them. The steak on the burrito was cooked to perfection and had a great carne asada flavor. I think the chorizo queso might have been the real MVP of the night, though. The perfect blend of cheese/chorizo with the perfect amount of spice. I'd endure the 50 million stop lights down South Blvd on the reg just to get that queso.   Pro tip: all burritos/tacos come with chips. Perfect way to try all of the sauces.

g4__DVhG9oJdACeYF8gZ6w.text: In a former life, I lived near Montford and I would drive past this place all the time without giving it a second thought. Thank God for Yelp. 4.5 stars strong? I had to come see what all the fuss is about.  Dollar tacos on Tuesdays? Yes please! They do beef, pork, and chicken options for the special. I went with two spicy chicken and a beef. Sidenote: the woman in front of me got a salad. Listen honey, you're doing Tuesdays wrong. I love the long laundry list of toppings you can choose from here. I can't really think of anyone else who does this. I was really impressed by the size of the tacos. At a lot of places, a Taco Tuesday special is pretty skimpy. Not here. My tacos were loaded.   Another bonus: THEY HAVE A SALSA BAR!! You know my motto, all places should have a salsa bar. Hell, I would put one in my living room if my roommate would let me. Wonder what she would do if she came home one night to find a salsa bar in place of the coffee table? My tacos came with free chips, so I was super happy to try #allthesauces.   It was pretty warm in there for lunch, but it was 103 degrees outside. Every place in Charlotte is warm right now in this heatwave. I didn't mind it a bit. I enjoyed eating my lunch alone and watching all the action in the restaurant. All the workers were really nice. There was a pretty steady stream of people coming in and out for lunch.   I don't live near here anymore, but I will definitely be coming back. It's well worth the drive. My only regret is that I never gave this place a chance sooner. However, that may be a good thing or else I would weigh 300 pounds.  Kudos, Burrito Factory. I really dig what you guys are doing here.

photos.caption: Photo of The Burrito Factory - Charlotte, NC, United States. Dollar tacos on Tuesdays!

uFCId5WstfgzCTFrNolDdA.text: I have driven by this place many many times and would have never thought to stop in. Thank God for Yelp! On the recommendation from a few awesome fellow Yelpers, my husband and I stopped in for lunch on Saturday.  First thing I noticed when walking in is the salsa bar! Salsa bars rock!  There are few tables in there. We ate in but I got the impression most people ordered to go.   We decided to split the California fish burrito and a side of chips and queso. I was a little nervous at first cause it took a little time to get the burrito together....what i didnt realize was it was becuase they were frying the plaintains on the spot!! The burrito was ginormo (thank gosh we split it cause i was full for like 8 hours after!) and had rice, beans (half black, half pinto), tilapia, pico, and plaintains. Super messy, yet super delish! The queso was that white queso and was really good. I love me some queso!   Good thing for me is that soon we are moving really close to th Burrito Factory......bad thing for my workouts cause Im gonna have to amp them up to compensate for discovering this place!

photos.caption: Photo of The Burrito Factory - Charlotte, NC, United States. California fish burrito

egCv1p9y5XNAImLGCXKP2Q.text: Had an amazing tofu burrito, so flavorful and filling! The home style, yummier version of moes, chipotle, salsaritas. Love supporting local businesses!

BizcUpM4zinnuDg5umLeaw.text: After being a chef for almost 20 years, I am usually not wowwed by much but this place is great. First off the kitchen is super clean which is a huge deal for me. And the food was fresh and amazing ill be back often

eslxgIBWITvzedG9WD11bA.text: Great fat heady burrito. Cali burrito is my go to. Great prices too. Definitely worth checking out.

28GI_XxijKhyS7w2NmOC-w.text: I've been there once.  I did happen to go on a night they were offering a 5.99 anything on the menu (ups the value point) special.  I took that chance to get both a big chicken and cheese quesadilla and big meaty burrito.  Both came with chips.  The chips were good but the salsa bar was of the refridgerated variety.  While that's obviously good toward keeping things fresh, the problem was everything was so near the freezing point that you couldn't each your chips with salsa.  The excellent queso stepped in for a save.  The two entrees were bland and the seating area left much to be desired.  All in all, it's not bad but not so good as I'd want to return.  It's a home grown effort with out the million dollar budget chain restaurants use to get the details right, I know.  It's when a small mom and pop's joint still manages to get the details worked out, you have found a winner.

2olQSed1E4VnPfMq5V1EHg.text: good food, though over priced, in my opinion. I will probably give them more stars after a while though. They seem to be quick and the food IS good. they are also investing in the imaging.  it's just that the 5$ special turns out to be around 7$. But all in all I think it's a nice place to grab n run.

fpojJMvT7Oa_bSpvkbp1UQ.text: They hit it out the park once again. I love there food and customer service. I only wish they had a location in Raleigh, NC. There burritos are amazing and on Thursdays everything is $5.49. This is a staple when I'm in the Charlotte area.

ACGP7SY-bs48x4TlvIRx1w.text: Great experience for a simple burrito spot. Great service, excellent food, & nice salsa bar.

1FnfvjveLelwgSBhUGNRfg.text: Totally unassuming from the street but the inside is remodeled and awesome. Food was fabulous and the staff was also great. Will defiantly be back. They offer delivery which is a always a bonus.

EsRdvloKM9h1M6ezX99i_Q.text: Had the pleasure of eating my first Shrimp Burrito at the Burrito Factory (BF) - incredible!  As a recent transplant from Arizona, I've been on the search for GREAT Mexican flavors, and the Burrito Factory has it.  The chicken and steak are very good, and the shrimp is cooked to order in a wonderful chipotle sauce.  Featured are the typical fillers of a Quoda and Chipotle - black/pinto beans, rice, pico, guacamole - but BF takes it to a whole-nother level with 2 choices of fresh cheese, fresh chopped cilantro and jalapenos, and other sides you won't find at the chain restaurants.  To compare with other very good fresh burrito/Mexican flavors in town (Phat Burrito and Cabo Fish Taco), BF sets itself apart with a well-balanced mix of authentic Mexican spices/flavors.  To top it off, you get a generous portion of homemade corn tortilla chips and access to a FREE homemade salsa bar.  The salsas attest to the skill and authenticity of the staff, showcasing a wonderful bouquet of roasted peppers, onions, and spices.  The inside decor is every bit as clean and sleek as a Chipotle with the simple casualness of a real California-Style burrito joint.  Also, the staff is friendly and helpful.  BF gets a 4 out of 5 for excellently prepared food, great flavors, and a level of authenticity that simply can't be found in other fast-food burrito joints in town.  If you have an adventurous palate or are looking to experience True Mexican flavors, the Burrito Factory is a must eat in Charlotte!

RanleCdNZ9u-8LG_LiCddQ.text: The people who work here are super nice and the veggie burrito is SOOOOO GOOD! Zucchini, kale, squash, feta, omg I love it! So glad a burrito spot by my house is this delicious!

4QC_hylvgRY9GJagN_FnWQ.text: New favorite lunch location. Sam is great and willing to do whatever it takes for his costumer to love the experience. Chips are pretty good, could be a little warmer. Very friendly staff. Very fresh and healthy burrito toppings.   I usually get the burrito on special or .99 cent tacos on Tuesday. Love this place!

H7jUaQF1QSlZ5zyxs0nbqg.text: This place is amazing! Best burritos I've ever had. The meat is perfect but the toppings couldn't be more fresh,  every time I come in it's as if they were just prepared.  The finely diced jalapenos are the heat!  They have a Salsa bar with lots of variety and an excellent drink selection,  the regular stuff as well Mexican specials.  This is my first 5 star restaurant.

2QVKc__sMtnjlXT-rlaa9g.text: Lived in SoCal for 14 yrs btwn LA & SD.  This reminds me of an upscale Tijuana joint w blasting Tenants music & Univision on the TV.  Great remodel - difficult to get into if you are going north on South Blvd.  Funniest thing - I've never seen a sign that says if you are wearing a mask or hoodie don't come in.  Stale chips. I had the CA Fajita burrito - large but something just wasn't tasty maybe the peppers & onions which had no color.  My better half had the juice steak & really enjoyed it.

1HmG7p0rzEIUhlN-KnG0Bw.text: Last week was my first time to the Burrito Factory and it was Awesome!  It might not look like anything special from the outside but inside it's completely redone in industrial chic. The food was fast, affordable and delicious and the staff was so friendly and helpful.  Get there early for lunch because it's so good, by 12 there is a line out the door.  I go every Tuesday for $1 tacos!

T2rMhQDCHaZ4L_QoJLA97w.text: My girlfriend and I just recently moved here from the west coast and have been searching for burritos like home! Factory burrito has the best burritos in the whole Charlotte area! Sam, the owner stayed open an extra 30minutes just so we could get from Concord to Charlotte an enjoy burritos for dinner. Amazing owner, amazing staff, an amazing food!! My girlfriend and I recommend the wet California burrito you can not go wrong! Thank you Sam we will see you again soon!!!!

cQ7Y4qNUoQDJfgHtq4La0A.text: Stopped here after reading Yelp reviews and was happy I did.  Great service from Sam, the owner, who was enthusiastic about his food and had reason to be.  Give it a shot.

9-b-J0BGKYDlSdGtFtrAZw.text: Okay so I'm conflicted about Burrito Factory. I'd probably give 3.5 stars if that was an option but it's not so I'm sticking with 3. There are a few things on this menu that I'd give a higher rating to. The nachos for example I really love. You can put basically anything you want on them to build your own and that's awesome!! The burritos are okay. We've tried the steak fajita, the chicken, and the california wet burritos. The first two lacked any kind of real flavor. No spices or salt or anything else appeared to have been used. However these burritos are packed full of ingredients and they don't skimp. The California wet burrito is better but again just okay. They give you salsa, and they have these other sauces. The orangeish looking sauce is my boyfriends favorite. He always wants me to order extra extra of that stuff as he can't get enough. It will save the burritos lol!! The plantains are good (hard to mess that up) and the queso is good but could use jalapenos in my opinion. We order delivery from them frequently and the poor delivery guy apparently has issues. He's really nice but sometimes I feel like he lacks awareness. He's delivered to us like 4 maybe 5 times and he still calls to ask exactly where our complex is because it doesn't show up on his GPS. I really am going to need him to update his GPS or use google maps!! However our food still always arrives pretty hot so that's a plus, the negative is my sour cream arrived melted into a soup so I just don't order it anymore lol. This place is a convenience factor for us so we'll probably continue ordering from here on occasion. I feel like if a few kinks were worked out this place could really shine.

9r9Im7x9Hb09_hYVKM28uA.text: Really nice and friendly customer service. Burrito was good. Better than average, but not memorable. We'll be back to try the fish tacos.

93ixyAe2lT8uKn3-FDWmrQ.text: WOW!  That's all I can say about this place!  Authentic and good.  Great fillings and fresh meats.  I loved Moes but graduated to Chipotle and thought it was the pinnacle peak as far as burritos go.  But I got a wild hair and decided to look for more burrito spots.  I came across this place based off it's solid reviews.  I drove 25 minutes just to get take out from here.  Solid sauces, solid chips, GREAT BURRITOS!  Give it a try!!!

oiW__nSupuhiwtZTSisknA.text: Save yourself the trip and go to Chipoltle or even Taco Bell! This place is way overcrowded and not worth the wait. I ordered 6 tacos on taco Tuesday and my date had a steak burrito. I had 2 of each (chicken, pork, and ground beef) and the chicken was good beef was ok and the pork was inedible. The salsa bar was nice but not enough chips. My dates burrito was overlooked for steak. Also just for sour cream is an extra .50 cent! Most places don't charge extra for that!! Will not return due to price and quality. Overall bad experience with some below average food. Next time will get a quesorita at Taco Bell and save 10$!

k2yr75MYMqSCvOWhdWEt1w.text: I cannot recommend the Burrito Factory high enough.  Everything that I have had there has been fantastic.    My recommendation - ask the cook to surprise you with their choice.  Typically I find my 1-2 dishes that I always get at a restaurant, but not here.    I wish the University location had made it.  Much closer to home.

_0tsQ6TzS3Ng26r92wP9qg.text: Just moved to the neighborhood, saw this place was well reviewed and tried it.  I am not entirely sure I can eat Mexican food anywhere else now.  Let's start with Taco Tuesday. I have a favorite Latin street food place in Charlotte that has $1 tacos on Tuesday, too, and as another reviewer said, you can tell they're $1 tacos. Not Burrito Factory, nope. They give you the same tacos as any day of the week. Beef, chicken or pork, lettuce, queso blanco and the freshest pico around. And chips.  For like $.50 you can get salsa with it. I don't know about you, but a meal like that is a good value. A meal as DELICIOUS as that for less than $5? Amazing.   The tacos at Burrito Factory are so good, it's hard to get anything else. But the name isn't Taco Factory, so I highly encourage you to try their burritos. We've had four varieties so far and can tell you the California Wet Burrito is our favorite. It's CRAZY BIG, though, so expect to have some for leftovers.   Their guacamole is as good as the table-side fresh-made guac at expensive restaurants. And their salsa...HOLY CROW IS IT AMAZING. My favorite is the guajillo, husband loves the tomatillo, and we both enjoy the habenero, but it is genuinely hot. Like, make sure you have something to drink nearby hot.   We are still working our way through the menu, but I have to tell you you will be hard pressed to find better food, greater quality and nicer people than at the Burrito Factory. Give them a try.

VT_XjRjnlJPJ9K-ZoooQsQ.text: I've driven past this place tons of times. I made a mental note to check it out, after I saw the yelp reviews.   Ambience: The restaurant is off South Blvd and Archdale, but very easy to miss. Walking in I was happy to see that the place was clean. There are 7 or so tables. No frills, just a simple layout. The health score was a 96 (A).   Food: The menu had something for everyone. Beef, chicken, tofu, shrimp and fish. There are a couple burrito styles. They offer nachos, tacos, and quesadillas, as well as salads. I opted for the Cali wet burrito, subbing shrimp for the ground beef (meat, queso, beans rice, pico and FRIES!). Since I got shrimp, they were cooked fresh to order. This made the wait time a little longer, but I'm fine with that. The burrito was HUGE! Stuffed! I added cilantro, guac and extra cheese. My bf got the veggie burrito, the squash and zucchini were sauteed to order.  The only reason I docked a star was the stale chips, ugh.  Service: There was one man working, he was very pleasant. He did well juggling cooking our food and filling other orders. He was a little slow moving. But it was a Sunday and we were in no hurry.   All in all, we'll definitely be back. $20 for a filling meal, drinks included. I could only finish half of my burrito.
