Nbt3KoQR8bOMl2NS_kdN-g.text: Eh updating my review. They no longer have a salsa bar and charge you for salsa sides. The $1 Tuesday taco menu is limited. No more tofu option which I loved! They come with lettuce cheese and pico now which is good but any additional topping is extra. It use to be only sour cream and guacamole extra.... but I like traditional tacos with cilantro and onion so will opt for the way it's severed vs paying extra for each topping.   Overall I'm disappointed in there Tuesday taco menu, as service seemed to drop last time we were there. However, don't get me wrong. Their queso was still on point and they serve free chips with your order. I guess you can't beat that.

Jqlfipqm0pU_mDWzgYHvgg.text: The wait is horrible.. a full hour and it wasn't on that special TACO TUESDAY...... the salsa had no taste... them I was told another 8 minutes for a shrimp taco... the food is not the same quality as the Mexican spot that I am use to.. I will not visit here again... I'm Not impressed and very disappointed!

Only one other guest was there. The place looked clean. I ordered a juice chicken burrito and added all the items I chose. The negative was that there was no guacamole available and the lady in the back was making it fresh. I would try them again. The chips and queso were really good addition. 5kVXvllWNUGznwAe-8VDkQ.text: So rumors are True.... it is a little sketchy looking on the outside, but inside is a GEM! From the second we walked in we were greeted by the friendly staff behind the counter. It is clean inside and there are a few places to sit. We opted for take out.    I ordered the Tofu burrito and my husband had the steak burrito. You are able to choose from a variety of toppings such as lettuce, pico de gallo, guacamole, sour cream, onions / peppers, and hot sauce. Now my husband always goes for the hottest sauce restaurants have, and this one was his favorite! Towards the bottom of the burrito he actually started getting red in the face .  Then, they hot press your burrito so that it stays together and nothing falls out. Huge plus! When we checked out they gave us chips with both of our burritos! Chips included.... what?!   Overall it was a great experience and we will definitely be back.

I visited on Taco Tuesday, as they offer $1 tacos. I ordered the spicy chicken tacos and a side of guacamole. The chicken in the tacos reminded me of the packaged grilled chicken strips that you purchase in the grocery store with sauce added. However, the guacamole was VERY good and worth a return visit.   Not much as to share. The experience left me feeling...meh.

K-yQmF20dpGL98jyoj4r9w.text: Probably the best burrito I've had since moving to Clt. I'm one of those people that crave guacamole every few days and I really wanted to try something different. I remembered coming across this place a while ago but by the time I got there it was closed! This time I picked a way earlier time and I was ridiculously happy. I went with the Burrito Al Pastor. It was supposed to have pork and all the fixings like guacamole, sour cream, rice, beans and cheese. They actually didn't have guacamole this time which was a bummer but the man making it offered to slice up and avocado and put the slices on it so of course I obliged. Might I add his cutting skills were A1! I asked him if he could cut it in half so I can take a pic and he was delighted to do so. He even helped me style the food so I can get my foodie fix! He was great! The food is not only great but the prices are super fair so yes I'd recommend this place to anyone!

Message to Owner: Keep up the great work!

IqzGRPOtA3XBjGGu2ss4Iw.text: Seriously amazing food!  The burritos are huge and so flavorful.  The chicken juice burritos with chipotle chicken are off the chain.  Tried the fish tacos, omg delicous!  Fresh talapia, with pico, lettuce, and cheese.  Great daily specials so you can try something new each time you visit.  The staff is always super friendly.  One of my favorite spots if Ian heading to or from uptown on south Blvd.

Best Nachos in Starmount, hands down. ---------------------------------------- In my opinion the only Nachos in Starmount worth paying for.  Just speaking for myself, I leave a tip when the food is good, and maybe sometimes if the food is okay and people are working harder than I am, that's when I leave a tip. It's not a scam.

1evnMOWb3J3tbbo_yuCSBA.text: I don't know if there is a new owner or what but things are different... We hadn't been here in a long time and stopped in for lunch, this time getting tacos instead of burritos. No longer do they have the salsa bar and the meat seemed tasteless. The steak tasted like it came our of a crockpot and the fish was just blah.. Today is saturday and the 'weekend special' item was blacked out. We wont be back.

7DbrkUx0MfINYqfdyQPyFg.text: Looking for fast lunch in south Charlotte that wasn't "Fast-Food" chain and found Burrito Factory.   Wow! Huge serving and under $10.   It's similar to the Moe's/Chipotle/Qdoba format but more authentic and flavorful.

t2GGRGHk_gJ_e8almYlecg.text: Finally got around to trying this place but wasn't very impressed. I got a shrimp burrito & the hubby had a steak burrito. Both were pretty bland. They need to add more seasoning to the food. Chips and salsa were good. The customer service is superb, very nice staff. I may try this place again but not in the immediate  future.

2Pi8AEBWzt7KIALjWpYspg.text: Super fresh. Absolutley delicious.  Salsa bar is wonderful.  The wet burrito is killer.  Way too much food, like thats a problem.  THREE DIFFERENT HORCHATA DRINKS ON TAP.  Really good.

ujjd4frZtfgdLkvxBSiPmA.text: If it was possible to give them 0 stars I would! Worst delivery service ever! Took them 2 hours and I only ordered 2 burritos some cheese dip and chips and their dessert. When they get here (2 hrs later) he didn't even have the cheese dip so he gave me 2 coca colas instead and on top of that the chocolate that was on the dessert spilled all over the inside of the bag! Needless to say I will never order from here again!

HRGBuhREgfjUzwPzbQeqFw.text: The food here is delicious! Always on the lookout for a good shrimp burrito my partner suggested we stop here before heading back to Atlanta. We both grew up in the West/Southwest and know what Mexican food should taste like.   She loved her shrimp burrito! She was still talking about it when we drove away. The secret ingredient seems to be their yummy chipotle sauce.   I'm a vegetarian so I was glad they had the tofu burrito. The rice in my burrito was perfect! It took me back to the days when I would sit at my neighbor's table and she would say "Here mijita, have some rice". Like home cookin. Yum!  Also, the creamy red salsa and creamy green salsa are on point!   I had one of those Jarrito (pineapple) sodas I used to love way back when and I was in heaven. Our meals were tasty and filling at a fair price.    The restaurant was humble but clean (the women's restroom was tidy). The service was excellent. It's clear that they take pride in their food.    I highly recommend this place.

8aI871lYcFQoUtapNvrZZw.text: Yummy! Went on a Thursday and everything on the menu was 5.99. Everyone was really nice and gave great recommendations. Get there early because the guacamole runs out! Best burritos in Charlotte!

clnkwM4mXCkoFl2qrnGemw.text: Great people, Great food. Definitely worth a try if you haven't yet.

ZWyZX5aORWSS5s3WFGGxaA.text: $1 tacos on Tuesday, what more can I say. I've only been here for the tacos but they are great. Fresh ingredients, tasty toppings, fresh salsa bar, I'm a fan. The only downfall was when I went they were out of pork. Try their tomatillo salsa is seriously the best I've ever had.

n6FT-bVru4TGWP8wvqK4Pg.text: Love this place! Clean and simple decor, nice staff, salsa bar and the best guacamole in Charlotte!

G3Z94i768B_VWAc-KVlNow.text: Great food and good prices. Super friendly staff. Be sure to try the orange and green sauces.

fKwQYlNaRekvcscJfrCmKQ.text: This place is awesome and has great deals! We got some chicken burritos and some queso and they were really good. They have fresh ingredients and don't skimp. Some people said they take their time but I'm glad they did! They made sure it wasn't a soggy mess. They actually want it to taste good and seem to care about what they are serving rather than some chain restaurants. The ladies working there were really really sweet. This is our new spot for Mexican!

aRbKBmbipFwSM2r_R_xnog.text: Being a So Cal native now living in Charlotte I can confirm that this really is California style Mexican food. Everything is fresh and made from scratch. If you are looking for Chipotle or Salsaritas  - then go there, this is what a real Mexican burrito tastes like! Now - if only Charlotte had a beach...

jikWSmxZSgeBRbVsUGeqdA.text: Part of me wants to keep this place a secret but it wouldn't be right to hide it from the public. These are the best burritos in town and possibly one of the best burritos I have ever had. Try the carnitas. They also have great specials. Clean, nice staff, burritos made with love.

_7FjAa4oV-ZYOZtWdI09qQ.text: Not impressed.  The chorizo was more like greasy ground beef, did not have any flavor. Tacos ans burritos are not authentic like they claim.  The employees were very nice and their salsa was delicious.  However, you are better off going to luptias getting a pound of meat and tortillas and calling it a day.

OLIGT4VfuBRn1cadNUOsxA.text: I WAS a huge fan of The Burrito Factory. My boyfriend and I usually come every Tuesday for $0.99 tacos and for Factory Thursdays  (entire menu $5.49). EVERY Thursday we order the same thing (shrimp burrito) and pay the $5.49 price . Well for some reason today , I get all the way through the line to pay and the lady says that shrimp is excluded and that it has ALWAYS been that way. Mind you there was NO sign specifying this. Another lady comes along and says "we tell everyone that it's only for chicken, beef, and pork". Well she nor anyone else told us that when we came in. We didn't have a problem with paying; HOWEVER, i informed her that we come every week and pay the same price, so this is a policy that is new. She then begin to argue me saying that it's always been this way and I never paid $5.49 for my shrimp burrito on a Thursday. We've noticed lately they have been taking things away and adding on extra charges without proper signage or notifying their customers. More specifically on Tuesday's and Thursday's . It's SHADY. Needless to say this was my last visit there , which is unfortunate because we have been loyal customers and think they have great food . Very disappointed in the customer service.

wC5DxbKvDfzG2afRo38mRA.text: This place looks like a total hole in the wall, but it is really good.  Everything seemed so fresh and made to order.  The salsa varieties were excellent and quantities are large enough for two meals.

YTv31r9If0Fklr7qrpccgg.text: it's honestly the best. I come every week. I don't understand how anyone isn't obsessed. The staff is so sweet. I'm always happy to wait in line on crazy days. I've had days where I went for lunch, got home and craved it for dinner. Their fried plantains are the best around.

_YH0BG8wt9nH0sjDfrpVBw.text: I decided to try this place on taco Tuesday since the tacos are only 1.00!!! I ordered two vegetarian tacos. The tacos were absolutely delicious they came on corn tortillas with your choices of beans and toppings!!! I also love this place because it is vegetarian friendly if you don't want meat you can get tofu which is a huge plus. You also get chips with access to the salsa bar. The chips provided to me were not so good they tasted over fried and oily the salsa bar was good though because it allows you the option to try a variety of salsas. I'm happy to say that I found a great place to grab Tacos on Tuesdays!!!!

VRxJwYmzTtPsQ1onH5yofQ.text: Great little hole in the wall. Cheap food that's good. Taco Tuesday = tacos $0.99. Cheese dip is good too. The restaurant is nothing fancy but a good find. :)

PHV_z1t-7XaAQJbDoW0olw.text: This place is easily the best - think Chipotle, but more fresh and more options. The prices are great, the salsa bar is UNMATCHED, and the service is always friendly. We have this delivered to our office whenever possible and it is always a HUGE hit.

_iZxf4MAxdj5GOnR-_jiWQ.text: I dare you to find a better salsa! The green salsa, the orange, and the burrito factory salsa at the salsa bar are hands down the best salsa I have ever had. I seem to always get the curry burrito (yeah sounds odd for a Mexican place) but it's a very barely there curry taste. The tofu burritos great too. The owner and servers are very kind and nice. But I'm serious...THE BEST SALSA.  I don't know why but south blvd has a large Hispanic community and horribly bad restaurants but the burrito factory is a rare gem!

L5ldoVgMH7SpgAx_iH6Kaw.text: We enjoyed our vegan burritos and the salsa bar.  I'd like to have seen the salsas marked with either ingredients or letting us know if the one was vegan friendly but it was no big deal.  It took five minutes or so for them to make our tofu but the man was extremely apologetic about it and offered us drinks and chips while we waited.  We'll be back, it was tasty!

xcNOQ-KBZT395wjdd2AGKg.text: I absolutely love Burrito Factory, especially the shrimp burrito.  Service is great and the staff are extremely pleasant!

en6wRH_2Y_UujzSJaeg2cQ.text: This place is great!  They have this salsa that is heaven in your mouth.  Strange orange color but oh so good!  Tacos were very good and they have a good topping selection.  I can't say enough about the great service.  The owner greeted us when we walked in and checked on us during our meal.  I really hope this place succeeds.  They have a good thing going.

s8v8CGkDOwwuKSP_gZQTRg.text: Place was great!  Burrito was overfilled and burrito bowl was delicious!  Steak and chicken were not very seasoned and the food was a tad bit bland. For that reason alone,  I'd give it 4.5 stars of i could. Great service!

Photo of The Burrito Factory - Charlotte, NC, United States. Steak burrito was big, overfilled and tasted good!

484zTJV2F_q6s5nB2Bsthw.text: I've had a lot of burritos in my day, and this one was exceptional. In fact, the best I've had east of the Mississippi. The employees here as a bonus were fantastic. They filled me in on everything and thanked me for coming in. I stumbled upon this place and soon realized they served the burrito of my dreams. A traditional California burrito with French fries mixed in. It sounds weird, but this is authentic SoCal style.   The two gentleman in front of me spoke no English and I saw upon entering they serve horchata. Instant legit authentic burrito joint points awarded. The interior was clean and had ample space. The hot sauce station offered a little bit of everything. Even the chips served free w/ the meal were refreshingly crisp and delicious. I could find no wrong with the Burrito Factory. What a knockout meal!

7NVUYRy1-90a9BuY1fDqyg.text: I'm from San Diego and have been in Charlotte for 5 years now. Burrito Factory is the first place I've found in Charlotte that does California's version of Mexican food justice. California burritos (the ones with french fries inside), fish tacos, shrimp burritos. It's spectacular.   This place is every bit the small, delicious taco shop that one sees on every corner in Southern California. And Sam the owner is awesome. We can't wait to come back - this place is going to be a regular stop for us!

v-ada8MVZqDFeS0UVbDvyg.text: OMG! The burritos are huge and delicious. Excellent tacos too. Their guajillo salsa is excellent on the al pastor burrito. Their beef burrito is super savory. All around awesome.

_8pLhhLIVMzLTc0uY24tjw.text: Seriously, best burrito in CLT! They have amazing options and I had a difficult time choosing what I wanted. Everything is fresh, spiced well, and super yummy. My burrito was HUGE and served with chips on the side. They have a great selection of salsa choices that were TO DIE FOR!    Didn't know they had a taco Tuesday so I def have to go back and check that out.

MZO24CZiWRAOTxeWz-X-wg.text: I have been wanting to go try the burrito factory for a while, but never had a chance,. Today 6-14-14 I finally made it, and I'm glad I did. I was greeted by who I believe it was the owner, I got the Wet burrito and it was the best burrito I had in years. The burrito was huge and it was filled with yummy goodness(beans,rice,meat,french fries,cilantro, etc) I also got chips inside my bag. The burrito was really good and so were the chips.   They have a Salsa bar, don't be afraid to try a few of them. Next time I will try the Fish Tacos ,   PS. Chipotle has nothing on them. Chipotle's burritos might be a little bigger but are bland, no flavor at all.    Give them a try, you wont regret it.

E-7jBTDX_gmnpj6Nhv5LxQ.text: I am so addicted to this place, I'm starting to wonder exactly what they put in their sauces. I am there at least twice a week, sometimes three or four times. Due to some language barriers, it can be difficult to get your order across, so consider just going with the "easy burrito." Speeds things up. Avoid Tuesdays and Thursdays because they have lunch specials, and the lines can get super-crazy. But definitely go. And go often.

yfDaCPaoG9U3XnX6x3lMaw.text: THANK GOD FOR BURRITO FACTORY.  I was beginning to get worried about the burrito scene in Charlotte. if you like a giant (and i mean HUGE) California style burrito, this is exactly 100% without a smidgen of a doubt where you need to go get your fix.   The staff is always friendly to everyone that walks in the door, and fast at what they do as well. All of the veggies are fresh and colorful, and they offer some unique options that other burrito spots do not; like banana peppers and these delicious pickled red onions that add a nice little sweet bite to your meal.   The menu offers more than just your average burrito, too. My advice: try the curry chicken, pork, and wet California burritos- ypu won't be disappointed there. Also make sure you make it out for Taco Tuesday, where you can grab pork, chicken, or ground beef tacos for 99 cents a piece.   Oh yeah, don't miss out on the salsa bar. Everything is made in house, and the guajadillo and tomatillo salsas come highly recommended. I love this place, as it's become a go-to for me and my friends!!

w47y5CFoTBVLNab4tk-udA.text: One of the best charlotte local burritos. You got to try California style curry chicken burrito. The yellow flavored rice with curry chicken and other few condiments. Oh my god. Taste explosion in mouth.   Don't get fooled by the exteriors. It has awesome interiors and people are very nice here. Place is really clean. Good luck with your burrito. Yes, I will keep coming.

LhHXwWdZLzwTWLlUbHseNw.text: You cannot get a better deal than $.99 taco Tuesday. The sauces are amazing and the employees are very friendly and happy.

kin_dUMVkIqIPqlFC2Kr5Q.text: While this place seemed to have quality food for a reasonable price I have to say you get what you pay for. I was the only person there initially, around 6:00, I had a quesadilla asked for everything except meat and it came out with beans and cheese. I asked for guacamole and sour cream which came on the side and was no more than a table spoon in a tiny plastic cup. I had to go back and ask for Salsa for my chips and again, a table spoon in the plastic cup.  If you want .99 burritos this is probably a great idea as I saw other people getting those a little later. Very cheesy machismo videos on the TV without sound. No me gusta mucho...

lIyvG_tbWF7cYzrUpTiAIQ.text: Not actually open till 9 pm on Sunday's. The sign on the door says otherwise but I was informed by an employee that they in fact close at 6pm on Sunday's.

m37ByKhMI23zSBgPSx0WQA.text: We picked this place solely on the good reviews --- and we were NOT disappointed! I highly recommend this place if your looking for a quick/sit down type restaurant.   The environment is definitely a dive but most dives have THE BEST FOOD! Similar to Moes and Chipotle, this places offers a massive "wet" California style burrito. Food is fresh and prepared to order. Reasonable priced with ongoing daily specials.   Not only is the food good, the customer service is absolutely amazing. The staff is outgoing/friendly and willing to go above and beyond to make the customer feel welcome.

_6axubqXlq20JpJdEJ5QDw.text: Excellent burritos and many other food choices. We are from Florida and wished we could've brought this restaurant home with us.

k7UzNJMlW6lHXs1yPDKNTA.text: Ding Ding Ding!   We have a winner!   Forget McDonalds owned Chipotle, forget Phat Burrito and Salsaritas.  This place beats them all in price and friendly service.  And the food?   Delicious!   Great Flavors all around.  Salsa bar?  Yes please.  Fyi the medium is an americans version of HOLY SHIOT my nose is running, "may I please have some sour cream nice sweet chica behind the counter?"     Decor is trendy and urban. But seriously, are we here for the decor or the food?   Give me a picnic table and paper towel dispenser on the table and I am happy.    If you have any doubts, I promise they will fade promptly as soon as the counter lady says hello.  If not, then shove that awesome burrito in your mouth, shut up and enjoy.  You can thank me later.

m5ef7bPlwAcbd8R_h9Adjw.text: We HAD to check this place out after we saw the amazing reviews. We all loved everything!!  Burritos, tacos.....  And the salsa bar!!?!  Perfect. I love the variety of drinks. My kids LOVE the horchata!!  The people that were working there were very kind, and offered fantastic suggestions. The whole place was really clean, and we enjoyed the atmosphere. We will definitely be back.

5HqNqeOkv_JOT27Le1jxMQ.text: Taco Tuesday - $1 dollar tacos. I had a spicy chicken,  beef, and pork taco and found the meat to be nothing special but the variety of fresh toppings and salsas more than made up for that. And you really can't beat solid $1 tacos with free chips.

qdUC2GnAkvTJx3kxbNOUNw.text: Food is good but unfortunately people with massive orders ruin the experience for everyone else. If you are in line and hear someone at the counter say "I've got multiple orders", just save yourself the trouble and leave.

TxuikWd3-qqGwXJmeppIUA.text: Not much to look at from the outside, but the parking lot decor isn't as important as what is inside. I'll echo some of the other Yelpers, this place rocks! I try to skip  carbs, so I avoided the rice and bean filled burritos. I ordered a salad, and had several choices of protein. I went with the steak, which was a great choice on my part. The toppings bar took a beating, I told the woman behind the counter to load me up with all the hot stuff, especially the diced fresh jalapenos. My wife ordered a shredded pork burrito, with no hot stuff. We are the odd couple.  After receiving our meals, I headed to the vaunted salsa bar. Other places might have more choices, but few have more creative choices. Regular & spicy pico de gallo, several mild to medium salsas, and a few with some heat. My favorite was the Guarillo, a medium heat orange colored smooth salsa.   How was our meal? Que delicioso! I chose the lime mint dressing for my salad, which blended well with the flames shooting from my bowl. The only complaint I had was that the lettuce could have been cut smaller or maybe shredded. Otherwise, my salad was far better than the other Mexican places we have tried. My wife's burrito was huge, she only finished half, she took the rest home with most of her tortilla chips. I rarely give 5 stars, tbf came pretty close. Maybe if one of the staff wasn't wearing a Jets cap, they would have gotten all 5. My wife is a Jets fan, I see enough of that crap at home. We will be back.

Zdi2auFZD51GRkuTf3d7Bw.text: Here's all you need to know about Burrito Factory in two words: Taco Tuesdays. Fresh-made, delicious tacos with your choice of fillings for a buck apiece, and they aren't skimpy with the ingredients. Choose from chicken, spicy chicken, marinated pork or ground beef (if you're boring) protein, and a plethora of toppings.  Being my predictable self, I go for the heat with spicy chicken, diced jalapenos, hot pico de gallo, queso fresco, lettuce, salsa, fresh cilantro and cheese. Skip the .75 extra guacamole in favor of the addictively sweet heat of their creamy green tomatillo sauce, free on the self-serve bar. Seriously, it's so good I always take some home in the little clear containers. Oh yeah, free salsa and chips with every order. Since it's so good and prices are so cheap, please also bless the tip jar and go home happy and satisfied.

Ilvsp7XS9hoGXZRY0fWVdg.text: Ordered this through delivery so that I could eat it the next day at lunch. Requested SPECIFICALLY no cheese because I break out into hives. My burrito was full of cheese. Awesome, now I'm hungry and itchy.

viOXj0plzM2b9wF5DZqTNA.text: I got the "wet" burrito from there. It was terrible. Also the first time I had French fries on a burrito. The salsa bar.....only one kind had any flavor whatsoever. The Pico de Gallo was basically chopped vegetables, no lime juice or even salt. Will not be back.

mlqSJRxY72-X7LFMubKabA.text: Love this place. It is right next to my house so we frequent regularly. Highly recommend the Beef tacos (not a beef person, but these beef tacos are unreal). They also do a great job keeping the food fresh and letting you add whatever/and as many toppings you want at no additional charge. Taco Tuesday is an awesome deal - we had 6 tacos with guac and were out of there paying around $10 total. great service, convenient salsa bar and awesome food!

0HqBA2vS8KgT8WraUmWFqw.text: This place has the best burritos ever. I got the Wet burrito and it was beyond delicious. Everything was very fresh and they give a good amount of chips with each burrito. The cashier was also very friendly. The parking lot is very small so if you see a spot don't assume there is one closer to the door.

aPqPWIcCA5nG3S-TbNlexQ.text: Went there last Sunday just to find it closed. It's way I ended up at the American burger co.  Could have been great but wouldn't know it. No signage to indicate why they were closed either

HuzjxYya-9gEvyrdeNpK8Q.text: is is the best burrito place in Charlotte I've been to so far. It's the only place around i know of where i can get a California Wet Burrito.
